alert.note: Alert for Fairfax; Prince William (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 4:39AM EST until December 18 at 8:30AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern Virginia, including the following counties, Fairfax and Prince William. * WHEN...Until 545 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 439 AM EST, Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen earlier tonight. Some river gauges in southern Prince William County remain on the rise, so the Flood Warning remains in effect for those areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dale City... Woodbridge... Quantico... Montclair... Triangle... Dumfries... Cherry Hill... Independent Hill... Mason Neck... - This includes the following Flood Prone Roads... Mine Road and Cameron Street. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
